name: Jägerita
instructions: Shake ingredients over cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
description: I know it’s a frat boy drink, but unless you’ve had it coming out of your nose at 4 in the morning and can’t physically drink the stuff, there’s no way you can look me in the eye and tell me that you don’t like Jägermeister because you’re a liar and I won’t believe you. Shoot it, sip it, I’ll take it any way I can get it. I even had my eyes opened one late night at Simon Difford’s house (hi, Simon!) when David Cordoba mixed up one of his famous Jägeritas and I practically begged him for the recipe.

ingredients.name: Jägermeister
ingredients.description: Jägermeister is a German herbal liqueur made with a blend of 56 different herbs, fruits, roots, and spices. It is known for its unique and complex flavor profile, with herbal, spicy, and citrus notes. Jägermeister is often consumed as a digestif or in various cocktails, and it is recognized by its distinctive green bottle and iconic logo featuring a stag.

ingredients.name: Cointreau
ingredients.description: Orange-flavoured triple sec liqueur, it was originally called Curaçao Blanco Triple Sec. Usually more dry tasting than Orange Curaçao.

ingredients.name: Simple Syrup
ingredients.description: Syrup made with sugar and water. Usually in 1:1 or 2:1 ratio.
